page.title: 04OCTAGON FARM
page.content: OCTAGON FARM. THIS 180 ACRE MIXED FARM HAS BEEN RENTED FROM BEDS.COUNTY COUNCIL SINCE THEY OBTAINED IT IN 1948.UNTIL 1902 IT WAS PART OF THE ESTATE OF THE DUKE OF BEDFORD.ITS NAME IS DERIVED FROM THE OCTAGON-SHAPED FARMHOUSE.THERE ARE 4 OTHER HOUSES ON THE LAND. ON THIS MEDIUM LOAM SOIL MR.SELLS GROWS BARLEY,WHEAT AND VEGETABLES SUCH AS BEETROOT,CABBAGE,CAULIFLOWER,PEAS AND BEANS.WATER IS EXTRACTED FROM THE ELSTOW BROOK WHICH FLOWS N.E. THROUGH THE FARM AND THE VEGETABLES ARE IRRIGATED WITH A MOBILE IRRIGATION UNIT. THERE ARE 26 BEEF CATTLE AND SOME CHICKENS. FOUR PEOPLE ARE EMPLOYED.FARM MACHINERY INCLUDES A COMBINE HARVESTER BALER,PLOUGH AND SIX TRACTORS.
